metadata.title: CVE-2024-38476 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in core of Apache HTTP Server 2.4.59 and earlier arevulnerably to information disclosure, SSRF or local script executionviaÂ backend applications whose response headers are malicious orexploitable.Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.4.60, which fixes this issue.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-38476` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.27+esm3
apache2-bin - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.27+esm3
apache2-data - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.27+esm3
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.27+esm3
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.27+esm3
apache2-utils - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.27+esm3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: apache2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.29-1ubuntu4.27+esm3').
